metadata.title: CVE-2015-1472 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The ADDW macro in stdio-common/vfscanf.c in the GNU C Library (aka glibc orlibc6) before 2.21 does not properly consider data-type size during memoryallocation, which allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial ofservice (buffer overflow) or possibly have unspecified other impact via along line containing wide characters that are improperly handled in awscanf call.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1472` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

eglibc-source - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc-bin - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6-amd64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6-armel - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6-i386 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6-pic - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6-ppc64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6-prof - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6-x32 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
multiarch-support - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
nscd - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: eglibc package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.19-0ubuntu6.6').
